sanskrit_verse:
अदीयमाना भर्तारमधिगच्छेद्यदि स्वयम् ।
नैनः किं चिदवाप्नोति न च यं साऽधिगच्छति ॥ ९.९१॥
transliteration:
adīyamānā bhartāram adhigacched yadi svayam |
na enaḥ kiṃ cid avāpnoti na ca yaṃ sā 'dhigacchati || 9.91||
sph_interpretive_translation: When a woman approaches her husband without being summoned, he gains nothing thereby, nor does she gain anything by approaching him.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority originates from conscious invocation, not mere physical act
Causation requires intentional alignment between parties
Capacity-based responsibility includes the awareness of relational timing and consent
Restoration logic demands recognition of uninvoked action as non-binding
Consciousness alignment necessitates mutual readiness for union
supreme_court_application: In adjudicating matters concerning marital or conjugal rights, courts must recognize that acts performed in absence of conscious invitation bear no enforceable consequence. Legal standing arises only when both parties have demonstrated capacity-based readiness through recognized invocation protocols.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that efficacy lies in intentional synchronization, not mechanical performance. Anupūrvaśaḥ reveals that effects follow only where consciousness aligns sequentially. Thus, no punitive measure applies—only acknowledgment that no binding occurred due to lack of mutual awakening.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Completion Process: Acknowledge the absence of conscious alignment without attribution of fault
Responsibility Assumption Protocol: Encourage re-establishment of communication regarding readiness and invitation
Capacity Restoration: Support both individuals in understanding conditions required for valid relational engagement
Integrity Reintegration: Reinforce recognition of union as sacred space requiring mutual awakening
final_declaration: This ruling flows directly from the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source-Authority. Dharma is restored through recognition of union's dependence upon conscious invocation. Reality remains non-punitive; consciousness alone adjudicates truth.
